citation.article-title: Burkholderia tuberum sp. nov. and Burkholderia phymatum sp. nov., nodulate the roots of tropical legumes.

p.s: Description of Burkholderia phymatum sp. nov.
Burkholderia phymatum (phy.ma'tum, Gr. n. phyma, nodule, tuber, hence N. L. gen. pl. n. phymatum, of nodules)
Cells are Gram-negative, non-sporulating, straight rods.
Growth is observed at 28°C, not at 42°C.
Nitrate is reduced, but no denitrification.
Oxidase and betagalactosidase activity is present.
No tryptophanase, urease or arginine dihydrolase activity.
No liquefaction of gelatin or hydrolysis of aesculin.
Assimilation of D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, D-gluconate, caprate, but not of maltose, adipate, L-malate, citrate, or phenyl acetate.

Alkaline and acid phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, and phosphoamidase activity is present; esterase C4, ester lipase C8, lipase C14, valine and cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, alfa-galactosidase, beta-glucuronidase, alfa- and beta-glucosidase, N-acetyl-beta-glucosaminidase, alfa-mannosidase, and alfa-fucosidase activity was not detected.

The whole-cell fatty acid profile of strain STM815T comprised 14:0 (4.6%), 14:0 3OH (8.7%), 16:1 ω7c (22.6%), 16:0 (19.6%), 17:0 cyclo (4.0%), 16:1 2OH (1.6%), 16:0 2OH (1.0%), 16:0 3OH (6.6%), 18:1 ω7c (28.5%), and 19:0 cyclo ω8c (1.2%) as major components (summed feature 2 [comprising 14:0 3OH, 16:1 iso I, an unidentified fatty acid with equivalent chain length value of 10.928, or 12:0 ALDE, or any combination of these fatty acids], and summed feature 3 [comprising 16:1 ω7c or 15 iso 2OH or both] are listed as 14:0 3OH and 16:1 ω7c, respectively, as these fatty acid have been reported in Burkholderia species [15].
The G+C content is 62.1 mol%. B. phymatum was isolated from root nodules of Machaerium lunatum in French Guiana.
The type and presently only strain is STM815T (= LMG 21445T, CCUG 47179T).
Its 16S rDNA sequence has been deposited in the GenBank database under accession number AJ302312.
